abstract: The conglomerate Loews said on Monday it would buy gas exploration and production assets in three states from Dominion Resources for $4.025 billion in cash, betting on rising natural gas prices as it diversifies its revenue stream. The company said it will retain Dominion’s existing management, led by Timothy Parker, a senior vice president of exploration and production.
lead_paragraph: The conglomerate Loews said on Monday it would buy gas exploration and production assets in three states from Dominion Resources for $4.025 billion in cash, betting on rising natural gas prices as it diversifies its revenue stream. The company said it will retain Dominion’s existing management, led by Timothy Parker, a senior vice president of exploration and production.

headline.main: Loews to Acquire Gas Assets from Dominion for $4 Billion
